chapters.name: The Stream of Gold (Complete Alternate Hymn)
chapters.summary: The full 21-verse hymn as commonly recited, emphasizing the Goddess’s wealth, beauty, and presence on the body of Lord Viṣṇu.

verses.original:
अङ्गं हरेः पुलकभूषणमाश्रयन्ती
भृङ्गाङ्गनेव मुकुलाभरणं तमालम्।
अङ्गीकृताखिल-विभूतिरपाङ्गलीला
माङ्गल्यदाऽस्तु मम मङ्गळदेवतायाः॥
verses.transliteration:
aṅgaṁ hareḥ pulaka-bhūṣaṇam-āśrayantī,
bhṛṅgāṅganeva mukulābharaṇaṁ tamālam।
aṅgīkṛtākhila-vibhūtir-apāṅga-līlā,
māṅgalyadā’stu mama maṅgaḷa-devatāyāḥ॥

translations.english: May the sportive side-glance of the Goddess of auspiciousness, which is the source of all prosperity, be the giver of welfare to me. She rests upon Lord Hari's (Viṣṇu's) body, which is adorned with goosebumps (of joy), just as a female bee rests upon a Tamāla tree adorned with flower buds.

verses.original:
मुग्धा मुहुर्विदधती वदने मुरारेः
प्रेम-त्रपा-प्रणिहितानि गतागतानि।
माला दृशोर्मधुकरीव महोत्पलै या
सा मे श्रियं दिशतु सागर-सम्भवायाः॥
verses.transliteration:
mugdhā muhur-vidadhadhatī vadane murāreḥ,
prema-trapā-praṇihitāni gatāgathāni।
mālā dṛśor-madhukarīva maheth-pale yā,
sā me śriyaṁ diśatu sāgara-sambhavāyāḥ॥

translations.english: May the garland of glances of the daughter of the Ocean (Lakṣmī), which repeatedly fall upon the face of Murāri (Viṣṇu) with shyness, love, and devotion, like a swarm of bees moving between large blue lotuses, bestow wealth upon me.

verses.original:
आमीलिताक्षमधिगम्य मुदा मुकुन्दम्
आनन्दकन्दमनिमेषमनङ्ग-तन्त्रम्।
आकेकरस्थितकनीनिका-पक्ष्मनॆत्रम्
भूत्यै भवेन्मम भुजङ्ग-शयानाङ्गनायाः॥
verses.transliteration:
āmīlitākṣam-adhigamya mudā mukundam,
ānanda-kandam-animeṣam-anaṅga-tantram।
ākekara-sthita-kanīnikā-pakṣma-netram,
bhūtyai bhaven-mama bhujaṅga-śayanāṅganāyāḥ॥

translations.english: May the joyful, half-closed gaze of the consort of the Serpent-sleeper (Viṣṇu), whose eyes are motionless, the seat of bliss, and the controller of Manmatha (Cupid), and whose pupils are fixed with a slight squint, bring me prosperity.

verses.original:
बाह्वन्तरे मधुजितः श्रितकौस्तुभे या
हारावलीव नभसीन्द्रनीलमयी विभाति।
कामप्रदा भगवतोऽपि कटाक्षमाला
कल्याणमावहतु मे कमलाऽऽलयायाः॥
verses.transliteration:
bāhv-antare madhu-jitaḥ śrita-kaustubhe yā,
hārāvalīva nabhas-īndra-nīla-mayī vibhāti।
kāma-pradā bhagavato’pi kaṭākṣa-mālā,
kalyāṇam-āvahatu me kamalā''layāyāḥ॥

translations.english: May the garland of glances of the Lotus Dweller (Lakṣmī), which grants desires even to the Lord (Viṣṇu), which shines in the space between the arms of the vanquisher of Madhu (Viṣṇu), upon the Kaustubha gem, like a necklace of sapphires, bestow welfare upon me.

verses.original:
कालाम्बुदाळि-ललितोरसि कैटभारेः
धाराधरे स्फुरति या तटिदङ्गनेव।
मातुः समस्त-जगतां महनीय-मूर्तिः
भद्राणि मे दिशतु भार्गवनन्दनायाः॥
verses.transliteration:
kālāmbudāḷi-lalitorasi kaiṭabhāreḥ,
dhārādhare sphurati yā taṭidaṅganeva।
mātuḥ samasta-jagatāṁ mahanīya-mūrtiḥ,
bhadrāṇi me diśatu bhārgava-nandanāyāḥ॥

translations.english: May the esteemed form of the Mother of all worlds (Lakṣmī, the daughter of Bhārgava), who shines on the charming, cloud-like chest of Kaiṭabhāri (Viṣṇu) like a flash of lightning on a cloud, bestow welfare upon me.

verses.original:
प्राप्तं पदं प्रथमतः खलु यत्-प्रभावान्
माङ्गल्य-भाजि मधु-माथिनि मन्मथेन।
मय्यापतेत् तदिह मन्थर-मीक्षणार्धम्
मन्दालसं च मकरालय-कन्यकायाः॥
verses.transliteration:
prāptaṁ padaṁ prathamataḥ khalu yat-prabhāvān,
māṅgalya-bhāji madhu-māthini manmathena।
mayy-āpatet tad-iha mantharam-īkṣaṇārdham,
mandālasaṁ ca makarālaya-kanyakāyāḥ॥

translations.english: May the slow, languid half-glance of the daughter of the Ocean (Makarālaya-Kanyakā), by whose power Manmatha (Cupid) first attained his place on the body of the auspicious Madhu-slayer (Viṣṇu), fall upon me here.

verses.original:
विश्वामरेन्द्र-पद-विभ्रम-दान-दक्षम्
आनन्द-हेतुरधिकं मुरविद्विषोऽपि।
ईषन्निषीदतु मयि क्षणमीक्षणार्धम्
इन्दीवरोदर-सहोदरमिन्दिरायाः॥
verses.transliteration:
viśvāmarendra-pada-vibhrama-dāna-dakṣam,
ānanda-hetur-adhikaṁ muravidviṣo’pi।
īṣann-niṣīdatu mayi kṣaṇam-īkṣaṇārdham,
indīvarodara-sahodaram-indirāyāḥ॥

translations.english: May the half-glance of Indirā (Lakṣmī), which resembles the inner beauty of a blue lotus, which is capable of bestowing the glorious position of the ruler of all worlds and is the supreme source of bliss even for the enemy of Mura (Viṣṇu), rest upon me for a moment.

verses.original:
इष्टा-विशिष्ट-मतयोऽपि यया दयार्द्रा
दृष्ट्या त्रिविष्टप-पदं सुलभं लभन्ते।
ह्रिष्टिं प्रहृष्ट-कमलोदर-दीप्तिरिष्टाम्
पुष्टिं कृषीष्ट मम पुष्कर-विष्टरायाः॥
verses.transliteration:
iṣṭā-viśiṣṭa-matayo’pi yayā dayārdrā,
dṛṣṭyā triviṣṭapa-padaṁ sulabhaṁ labhante।
hriṣṭiṁ prahṛṣṭa-kamalodara-dīptir-iṣṭām,
puṣṭiṁ kṛṣīṣṭa mama puṣkara-viṣṭarāyāḥ॥

translations.english: May the desired glance of the Lotus-seated Goddess (Puṣkara-Viṣṭarāyāḥ), which is moist with kindness, whose radiance is like the bright interior of a lotus, and by which even those with elevated desires easily attain the heavenly abode, bring about my fulfillment and joy.

verses.original:
दद्याद् दयानुपवनो द्रविणाम्बुधाराम्
अस्मिन्नकिञ्चन-विहङ्ग-शिशौ विषण्णे।
दुष्कर्म-घर्ममपनीय चिराय दूरम्
नारायण-प्रणयिनी-नयनाम्बुवाहः॥
verses.transliteration:
dadyād dayānupavano draviṇāmbu-dhārām,
asminn-akiñcana-vihaṅga-śiśau viṣaṇṇe।
duṣkarma-gharmam-apanīya cirāya dūram,
nārāyaṇa-praṇayinī-nayanāmbu-vāhaḥ॥

translations.english: May the cloud (Nayanāmbuvāha) that is the eye of Nārāyaṇa's Beloved, moved by the wind of compassion, remove the heat of bad karma far away, and shower the rain of wealth upon this distressed bird-chick (me) who has nothing.

verses.original:
गीर्देवतेति गरुडध्वज-सुन्दरीति
शाकम्भरीति शशिशेखर-वल्लभेति।
सृष्टि-स्थिति-प्रलय-केलिषु संस्थिता या
तस्यै नमस्त्रिभुवनैक-गुरोस्तरुण्यै॥
verses.transliteration:
gīr-devateti garuḍa-dhvaja-sundarīti,
śākambharīti śaśi-śekhara-vallabheti।
sṛṣṭi-sthiti-pralaya-keliṣu saṁsthitā yā,
tasyai namas-tri-bhuvanai-ka-guros-taruṇyai॥

translations.english: Salutations to the consort of the sole preceptor of the three worlds, who exists as the Goddess of Speech (Sarasvatī), as the beauty on Garuḍa's banner (Lakṣmī), as Śākambharī, and as the beloved of Śaśiśekhara (Pārvatī), established in the play of creation, preservation, and dissolution.

verses.original:
श्रुत्यै नमोऽस्तु शुभ-कर्म-फल-प्रसूत्यै
रत्यै नमोऽस्तु रमणीय-गुणार्णवायै।
शक्त्यै नमोऽस्तु शत-पत्र-निकेतनायै
पुष्ट्यै नमोऽस्तु पुरुषोत्तम-वल्लभायै॥
verses.transliteration:
śrutyai namo’stu śubha-karma-phala-prasūtyai,
ratyai namo’stu ramaṇīya-guṇārṇavāyai।
śaktyai namo’stu śata-patra-niketanāyai,
puṣṭyai namo’stu puruṣottama-vallabhāyai॥

translations.english: Salutations to Śruti (Vedas), the source of results of auspicious actions. Salutations to Rati (Love/Joy), the ocean of beautiful qualities. Salutations to Śakti (Power), who resides in the hundred-petalled lotus. Salutations to Puṣṭi (Nourishment), the beloved of Puruṣottama (Viṣṇu).

verses.original:
नमोऽस्तु नालीक-निभाननायै
नमोऽस्तु दुग्धौदधि-जन्म-भूत्यै।
नमोऽस्तु सोमामृत-सोदरायै
नमोऽस्तु नारायण-वल्लभायै॥
verses.transliteration:
namo’stu nālīka-nibhānanāyai,
namo’stu dugdhau-dadhi-janma-bhūtyai।
namo’stu somāmṛta-sodarāyai,
namo’stu nārāyaṇa-vallabhāyai॥

translations.english: Salutations to Her whose face resembles a lotus. Salutations to the splendour born from the milk ocean. Salutations to the sister of Soma (Moon) and Amṛta (Nectar). Salutations to the beloved of Nārāyaṇa.

verses.original:
नमोऽस्तु हेमाम्बुज-पीठिकायै
नमोऽस्तु भूमण्डल-नायिकायै।
नमोऽस्तु देवादि-दया-परायै
नमोऽस्तु शार्ङ्गायुध-वल्लभायै॥
verses.transliteration:
namo’stu hemāmbuja-pīṭhikāyai,
namo’stu bhūmaṇḍala-nāyikāyai।
namo’stu devādi-dayā-parāyai,
namo’stu śārṅgāyudha-vallabhāyai॥

translations.english: Salutations to Her whose seat is the golden lotus. Salutations to the mistress of the Earth. Salutations to Her who is intent on bestowing mercy to the Devas and others. Salutations to the beloved of the wielder of the Śārṅga bow (Viṣṇu).

verses.original:
नमोऽस्तु देव्यै भृगु-नन्दनायै
नमोऽस्तु विष्णोरुरसि स्थितायै।
नमोऽस्तु लक्ष्म्यै कमल-आलयायै
नमोऽस्तु दामोदर-वल्लभायै॥
verses.transliteration:
namo’stu devyai bhṛgu-nandanāyai,
namo’stu viṣṇor-urasi sthitāyai।
namo’stu lakṣmyai kamala-ālayāyai,
namo’stu dāmodara-vallabhāyai॥

translations.english: Salutations to the Goddess, the daughter of Bhṛgu. Salutations to Her who resides on the chest of Viṣṇu. Salutations to Lakṣmī, who resides in the lotus. Salutations to the beloved of Dāmodara (Viṣṇu).

verses.original:
नमोऽस्तु कान्त्यै कमल-ईक्षणायै
नमोऽस्तु भूत्यै भुवन-प्रसूत्यै।
नमोऽस्तु देवादिभिर्-अर्चितायै
नमोऽस्तु नन्दात्मज-वल्लभायै॥
verses.transliteration:
namo’stu kāntyai kamala-īkṣaṇāyai,
namo’stu bhūtyai bhuvana-prasūtyai।
namo’stu devādibhir-arcitāyai,
namo’stu nandātmaja-vallabhāyai॥

translations.english: Salutations to Kānti (Luster), whose eyes are like lotuses. Salutations to Bhūti (Prosperity), the mother of the universe. Salutations to Her who is worshipped by Devas and others. Salutations to the beloved of the son of Nanda (Kṛṣṇa/Viṣṇu).

verses.original:
सम्पत्-कराणि सकलेन्द्रिय-नन्दनानि
साम्राज्य-दान-विभवानि सरोरुहाक्षि।
त्वद्वन्दनानि दुरिताहरणोद्यतानि
मामेव मातर-निशं कलयन्तु मान्यम्॥
verses.transliteration:
sampat-karāṇi sakalendriya-nandanāni,
sāmrājya-dāna-vibhavāni saroruhākṣi।
tvad-vandanāni duritāharaṇodyatāni,
mām-eva mātara-niśaṁ kalayantu mānyam॥

translations.english: O Lotus-eyed Mother (Saroruhākṣi)! May my salutations to you—which bestow prosperity, delight all senses, confer the might of an empire, and strive to remove all sins—make me worthy (of respect) day and night.

verses.original:
यत्-कटाक्ष-समुपासना-विधिः
सेवकस्य सकलार्थ-सम्पदा।
सन्तनॊति वचनाङ्ग-मानसैः
त्वां मुरारि-हृदयेश्वरीं भजे॥
verses.transliteration:
yat-kaṭākṣa-samupāsanā-vidhiḥ,
sevakasya sakalārtha-sampadā।
santano’ti vacanāṅga-mānasaiḥ,
tvāṁ murāri-hṛdayeśvarīṁ bhaje॥

translations.english: I worship you, the Empress of Murāri's (Viṣṇu's) heart, whose worship by mere side-glances causes all wealth and objects of desire to flow to the devotee through speech, body, and mind.

verses.original:
सरसिज-निलये सरोज-हस्ते
धवलतमांशुक गन्ध-माल्या-शोभे।
भगवति हरि-वल्लभे मनोज्ञे
त्रिभुवन-भूति-करि प्रसीद मह्यम्॥
verses.transliteration:
sarasija-nilaye saroja-haste,
dhavalatām-śuka gandha-mālyā-śobhe।
bhagavati hari-vallabhe manojñe,
tribhuvana-bhūti-kari prasīda mahyam॥

translations.english: O Dweller in the lotus, O Lotus-handed one, O one shining with pure white garments, perfumes, and garlands! O Divine Mother, Beloved of Hari, the charming one, the bestower of the wealth of the three worlds—be pleased with me.

verses.original:
दिग्घस्तिभिः कनक-कुम्भ-मुखावसृष्ट-
सर्वाहिनी-विमल-चारु-जलाप्लत-अङ्गीम्।
प्रातर्नमामि जगतां जननीमशेष-
लोकाधिनाथ-गृहिणीममृताभिपुत्रीम्॥
verses.transliteration:
digghastibhiḥ kanaka-kumbha-mukhāvasṛṣṭa-
sarvāhinī-vimala-cāru-jalāplata-aṅgīm।
prātar-namāmi jagatāṁ jananīm-aśeṣa-
lokādhinātha-gṛhiṇīm-amṛtābhi-putrīm॥

translations.english: I bow down every morning to the Mother of the worlds, whose body is bathed by the beautiful, pure waters from the mouths of the golden pots held by the Diggajas (elephants of the directions), the consort of the Lord of all worlds, and the daughter bathed in nectar.

verses.original:
कमले कमलाक्ष-वल्लभे त्वम्
करुणा-पूर-तरङ्गि-तैः-अपङ्गैः।
अवलोकय मामकिञ्चनानाम्
प्रथमं पात्रमकृत्रिमं दयायाः॥
verses.transliteration:
kamale kamalākṣa-vallabhe tvam,
karuṇā-pūra-taraṅgi-taiḥ-apāṅgaiḥ।
avalokaya mām-akiñcanānām,
prathamaṁ pātram-akṛtrimaṁ dayāyāḥ॥

translations.english: O Lotus Goddess, Beloved of the Lotus-Eyed one (Viṣṇu)! Please look upon me with a compassionate glance, filled with waves of mercy. I am without possessions, the foremost and natural object of your pity.

verses.original:
स्तुवन्ति ये स्तुतिभिर्-अमीभिर्-अन्वहं
त्रयीमयीं त्रिभुवन-मातरं रमाम्।
गुण-अधिका गुरुतरा-भाग्य-भागिनो
भवन्ति ते भूवि बुधा-भावित-आशयाः॥
verses.transliteration:
stuvanti ye stutibhir-amībhir-anvahaṁ,
trayī-mayīṁ tribhuvana-mātaraṁ ramām।
guṇa-adhikā gurutarā-bhāgya-bhāgino,
bhavanti te bhuvi budhā-bhāvitā-āśayāḥ॥

translations.english: Those who daily praise Ramā (Lakṣmī), who is the embodiment of the three Vedas and the Mother of the three worlds, with these hymns, become virtuous, possessors of great fortune, and are considered intelligent and purified in heart on this Earth.
